alert.note: Alert for Northern Blaine County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 1:14PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Blaine County through 200 PM MDT... At 113 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Turner, or 34 miles west of Whitewater. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Localized flooding and gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Turner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
